fields.description:
We use hosted Jira and Confluence. 

Trying to link about 29 issues to one issue.

When I use the + button to add issue links, the advanced search option only returns about 12 of the 29 results it should. search sample fixversion = "my version"

I would use a Parent task but the limitation imposed by that, no more than one level of parent child is ridiculous so I won't use it.
fields.summary: Add issue links - advanced search returns only partial results list

fields.description:
Page: Select a project  -> Administration -> Roles

If I switch my user language to German, the project roles config page looks and works differently than in the English version:
- The project role names are missing, so it's unclear what the four rows mean.
- Editing the roles works, but it's quite inconvenient because there is no "Update" button. You can only save one section by clicking on the edit button of another section.

I attached screenshots of the English and the German version.
fields.summary: Project roles config page broken in German translation

fields.description:
Most of the External content macros are not displayed on the system language on the macro browser. I've seen them being displayed with Japanese characters as an example.
This is not a general issue. I've seen some cases occasionally, but not many.
fields.summary: External content macros are not displayed on the system language

fields.description:
The chart for the Pie Chart Gadget is not responsive at the moment and doesn't resize properly.

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Add the Pie Chart Gadget to dashboard.
# Edit the layout - choose a smaller column for the gadget.
# Check the chart.

h3.Expected Results:
The chart should be properly resized to fit the frame.

h3.Actual Results:
The chart is not responsive and doesn't resize to fit the frame properly. 

h3.Workaround:
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Pie chart gadget does not resize properly

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Select the desired issue
# Press the '.' key and type 'create sub-task' to open the 'Create Sub-task' dialog.

The dialog header will read "Create Subtask". It should say "Create Sub-Task".
fields.summary: Create Sub-Task dialog has incorrect header

fields.description:
h3. The Application Navigator option is gone from System > User Interface > Application Navigator in JIRA 7

*

h3. Environment

JIRA 7

*
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access an instance already migrated to JIRA 7
# Go to System > User Interface > Application Navigator

*
h3. Expected Results

Choose  *> System> User Interface* and access * Application Navigator*.

*
h3. Actual Results

Application Navigator option does not show up when following the above steps.

*
h3. Notes

Documentation with “ Adding links to the application navigator” steps:


https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-346948276.html

Previous versions of JIRA don't seem to be affected.
*
h3.Workaround

In JIRA home page, click on the Navigation menu (top left corner) and then choose “Configure…” .
fields.summary: Application Navigator is gone from System > User Interface > Application Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While importing a zipped backup using [Restoring a JIRA Cloud Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Restoring+a+JIRA+Cloud+Backup+into+a+JIRA+Cloud+instance] procedures, the system will complain that it does not contain any valid attachments.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud 6.4.*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Backup instance using [Exporting issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Exporting+issues] procedure.
# Import on Cloud using the [Restoring a JIRA Cloud Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Restoring+a+JIRA+Cloud+Backup+into+a+JIRA+Cloud+instance] procedure, ensuring the attachments are listed correctly as mentioned on the article.
# Instance complains, saying "This archive doesn't contains any valid attachments."

h3. Expected Results
Import should be successful. 

h3. Actual Results
Instance will throw error from above. If there *is* a problem, it should say "This archive doesn't *contain* any valid attachments."
 
h3. Notes
I was not able to replicate this 100% of the time. It seems to be with certain backups, but I am not able to determine the difference between a working one. It might have been related to which instance the backup originates.

h3.Solution / Workaround
The support engineer can export the attachments manually to the server.
fields.summary: Restoring JIRA Cloud backup to Cloud instance occasionally throws error This archive doesn't contains any valid attachments.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bulk Transition is not showing all affected statuses

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Have a project which is using classic default workflow (any similar should also work)
2. Have two issues in this project, one with Open status, the second with In Progress Status
3. Go though Bulk edit -> Bulk Transition operation until step 3

h3. Expected results
Table which exactly shows what statuses will be transitioned when you choose one of the options.

h3. Actual Results
!Zaznaczenie_152.png!

Close Issue option shows that Open Status will be transitioned to Closed, what it really does it will transition both Open and In Progress statuses to Closed. This happens because both Open and In Progress issues are using the same Transition action:
!Zaznaczenie_153.png!

On this screen JIRA is silently ignoring other statuses and it's just showing just one of them.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit -> Bulk Transition is not showing all affected statuses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Created Vs. Resolved Gadget' will not work if the Dashboard is shown as a Wallbaord


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Created Vs. Resolved Gadget to your Dashboard
# Switch the Dashboard to Wallboard mode from the dropdown menu

h3. Expected Results
The Wallboard contains the gadget

h3. Actual Results
instead the following is displayed:
{quote}
There are problems with the current configuration for this gadget. The errors below may have been caused by the deletion of entities required by the gadget or by changes to your permissions.
No project or filter specified.
{quote}
!wallb.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
No Workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: Created Vs. Resolved gadget shows error in Wallboard mode

fields.description:
After the release of JIRA Cloud on November 3rd, no issues can be created on instances with project names containing special/control characters. 

*Symptoms*
The Create Issue dialog box does not load
The loading spinner will stay on the screen forever

*Workaround*
--Please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] to have this resolved for your instance.--
This issue has already been solved for JIRA Cloud in production.
fields.summary: Create issue dialog box does not load when there are project names with special / control characters

h5.workaround
Delete the Post Function referring to HipChat, or its JQL filter. Alternatively, try changing the order of post function to be after issue creation.
fields.summary: Issue creation throws "clauseValue should not be null" error when notification cannot be sent to HipChat

fields.description:
I want to see more then 100 results, click +Show More+ to see, nothing happens.
If there is a limit, then need either to pop a message or remove this confusing link.

But we do need more than 100, we do classification of user stories tagging them with labels for following categorization.
fields.summary: "Show more" link does not work in "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget

fields.description:
I have configured columns for my filter and want to export filter's results with defined columns. 
Columns configured for *My Filter* are different from *System* columns.

*Steps-To-Reproduce*
# Select Filter with custom column configuration
# Issue Navigator shows the issues with columns defined for this filter
# Select Export > Excel (Current fields)

*Actual Result*
# List of issues with *System* columns

*Expected Result*
# List of issues with *My Filter* columns
fields.summary: Export to "Excel (Current Fields)" ignores column configuration for the selected filter

fields.description: Changing issue security scheme on projects that have a big number of issues takes a long time and causes timeout / electric charlie in ondemand.
fields.summary: Changing issue security scheme causes timeout in ondemand

fields.description:
Hello
The problem described in JRA-40124 is still there in our JIra Ondemand instance, though it is said that the issue is fixed in 6.4 version. Please help

JIRA Info
Version 	6.4-OD-07-004
Test Project: https://yotadevices.atlassian.net/browse/AST
Assignable User: jdoe
fields.summary: Assignable Users are not assignable for an issue if they don't belong to the Issue Security Level permissions

fields.summary: "could not be resolved to an existing JIRA user" error logged when viewing Releases section with Anonymous user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'Projects' Dashboard gadget display is broken in the Wallboard view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# add the 'Projects' gadget to a JIRA dashboard;
# set the _View_ option to 'Brief' or 'Detailed';
# click *Tools > View as Wallboard* to display the Wallboard view of the dashboard.

h3. Expected Results
All the information visible in the Dashboard in the regular view is displayed in the Wallboard view as well.

h3. Actual Results
When displayed in the Wallboard view, the 'Projects' gadget is barely legible. It's not possible to read any information from the project progress bar (see screenshot).
fields.summary: 'Projects' dashboard gadget broken in the Wallboard view

fields.description:
h3. Description

Since the latest JIRA release (v7.0.0-OD-02-247), whenever the user try to create a new Post function of type Update Issue Field, the text shown on the issue Post function does not always reflect the Post function created.

*Examples:*
Updating the _*Assignee*_:
{noformat}
The Assignee of the issue will be set to $textutils.htmlEncode(${fieldValue}).
{noformat}

Updating the _*Priority/Resolution*_:
* If there's a Condition set in the same Workflow, the message displayed in the post function will be the same as the condition:
_Condition_
{noformat}
Only users in project role Service Desk Team can execute this transition.
{noformat}
_Post function_
{noformat}
Only users in project role Service Desk Team can execute this transition.
{noformat}
* If there's no Conditions, then the message displayed changes to:
{noformat}
Type: class
Class: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction
Arguments:
field.name = priority
full.module.key = com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.workflowupdate-issue-field-function
field.value = 4
{noformat}

It's impossible to re-order the Post functions when their descriptions match the condition set, but if the post function is displaying the type and class, reorder is possible again, however, if the reordering is done, the post function will mimic the behaviour of the exact above post function.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a condition in any workflow.
# Create a post function of type: _Update Issue Field_ to change the resolution field, for example.

*Expected*
The post function have its name and its properties.

*Actual*
The post function mimics the behaviour and properties of the conditions set.
fields.summary: JIRA Post function of type Update Issue Field is not displaying the set values

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When clicking on labels used in a custom field type 'label', you are directed to the issue navigator.
However, the result in the issue navigator are not filtered to correctly.
The JQL query in the issue navigator stays empty and all issues are displayed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a custom field type 'label' and add it to a screen.
# add a label to the custom field
# click on the label

h3. Expected Results

only issues with the label should be displayed in the issue navigator

h3. Actual Results

issues with and without the label are displayed in the issue navigator

h3.Workaround
In the issue navigator manually add label name in the {{More}} field
Or add {{'<custom field name>' = <label name>}} to the advanced filter JQL
fields.summary: Labels created on custom field type "Label" does not display the correct result when clicked

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 7, when one of the condition is not met, the status will be rolled back to the previous status (refer to [JRA-44681|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44681]). When trying to transition a Sub-Task, it is showing incorrect status in Issue Navigator and JIRA Agile board (Active Sprint View) when its post-function fails to trigger the transition on its parent issue.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a workflow with the following post function: On _To Do_ to _In Progress_: "Transition Parent with ID X" (transition parent issue from _To Do_ to _Done_ for example)
# Create a Task and put it to the _Done_ Status (such that the next step will fail when it executes the post-function)
# Create a _Subtask_ and transition it from _To Do_ to _In Progress_ (the transition where you've configured the post function in step 1)

h3. Current Result
- The status of the _SubTask_ is in _To Do_ (accessing from individual issue view) (/)
- The status of the _SubTask_ is in _In Progress_ (accessing from Issue Navigator, List View) (x)
- The status of the _SubTask_ is in _In Progress_ column (accessing from JIRA Agile Active Sprint view) (x)

h3. Expected Result
- The status of the _SubTask_ is in _To Do_ (accessing from individual issue view) 
- The status of the _SubTask_ is in _To Do_ (accessing from Issue Navigator) 
- The status of the _SubTask_ is in _To Do_ from JIRA Agile Active Sprint view) 

h3. Workaround
Re-index the project
fields.summary: Issue is showing incorrect status in Issue Navigator when the post-function is invalid

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a new issue collector on JAC for HipChat feedback, but I can't for two reasons:

1. The dropdown when I go to select an issue type in the "Add issue collector" page only shows project IDs

I dug through the code to find the project ID, so I then ran into:

2. The dropdown list only shows a certain number of projects and issue types (not all projects in the System).

I suppose there's a bigger question here of why does it even show issue types from other projects??

Steps to reproduce:
* Go to JAC
* Go to a project where you're a project admin
* Create an issue collector
* Click on the "issue types dropdown"
* BUG: You'll see the two bugs described above
fields.summary: Issue Collector "Issue types" dropdown shows Project IDs instead of names, and doesn't list all projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Due to recent update in adding file attachments with {{JIRA v7.0.0-OD-02-247}}  it is no longer possible to rename a attachment while pasting attachments to an issue using the Command + V option (MAC) or the CTRL + V option (windows) as the attach screenshot option has been removed and has been merged to the Attach File option.  And the ability to rename JIRA attachments is not currently available as described in:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25060

h3. Steps to Reproduce
As described in
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Attaching+a+Screenshot
# Copy Screenshot to clipboard
# Paste screenshot to issue

h3. Expected Results
Ability to rename screenshot on paste or after attached

h3. Actual Results
Image is attached to issue with default filename created by clipboard
 
h3. Notes
Previous functionality was MORE >> Attach Screenshot >> Paste Image 
- Could rename image at this point

h3.Workaround:
- Save screenshot to local file system
-- Can either download from ticket or
--- [For windows Use snipping tool | http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/use-snipping-tool-capture-screen-shots#1TC=windows-8]
--- For mac use save screenshot option rather than clipboard option
- Rename file
- Attach to Issue as file rather than clipboard option.
fields.summary: Rename File Attachments

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Cloud instance with JIRA + Confluence.
# Create a new project within JIRA and the corresponding linked Confluence space.
# Edit the home page of the Confluence space, go to Insert > Other Macros, select the JIRA Issues Calendar macro.
# In the Preview pane, start typing the project key of your newly-created project in the "Project or Saved Filter" field.

h3. Expected Results
The name of the project you searched for appears.

h3. Actual Results
In the Javascript console, two errors appear. The first shows [this URL|https://nmason-test.jira-dev.com/wiki/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest?refresh=3600&url=https%3A%2F%2Fnmason-test.jira-dev.com%2Frest%2Fgadget%2F1.0%2Fpickers%2FprojectsAndFilters%3FfieldName%3Dquickfind%26query%3DTEST&httpMethod=GET&headers=Accept%3Dapplication%252Fjson%252C%2520text%252Fjavascript%252C*%252F*%253Bq%253D0.01%26X-AUSERNAME%3D%26X-Atlassian-Token%3Dno-check&postData=&authz=&st=&contentType=JSON&numEntries=3&getSummaries=false&signOwner=true&signViewer=true&gadget=https%3A%2F%2Fnmason-test.jira-dev.com%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar%3Aissuescalendar-gadget%2Ftemplates%2Fplugins%2Fjira%2Fportlets%2Fcalendar%2Fgadget%2Fcalendar-gadget.xml&container=atlassian&bypassSpecCache=] returning a 400 ("Malformed header specified" if you go into it), and the second says:

{code:none}
[Error] TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'response.headers["x-seraph-trusted-app-status"]')
	handleResponse (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajax.js, line 15)
	(anonymous function) (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajax.js, line 15)
	hadError (auth-refresh.js, line 313)
	processResponse (auth-refresh.js, line 320)
	(anonymous function) (auth-refresh.js, line 70)
{code}

h3. Notes
This only affects the macro being embedded into a Confluence page, on JIRA's own dashboard it's fine. This also means that the gadget can't be inserted onto a page, as Confluence's macro browser gives a warning saying "Please complete the configuration in the preview area first".

h3.Workaround
No workaround yet.

In a comment in JIRA, you can right-click the chain icon to the right, and copy the permanent link to a comment. Previously, navigating to the URL would scroll you down directly to the comment itself. In a latest update, this no longer works.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Right-click the chain icon in a comment far down the page of an issue:
!Screen Shot 2015-09-23 at 2.30.35 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Open a new tab and paste the URL to attempt to browse to the issue.

- You should drop down to the comment selected.

h3. Actual Results
- The page reloads and you remain at the top of the issue.

No current workaround.

# Click on Configure Fields Tab, then Custom
# Checked the box for the custom field
# Custom field is now showing. When you next create an issue, JIRA remembers your last choice of selected fields.


*Expected Results*
Once a custom field is added in the Create Issue Screen and set it as show in Field Configuration, the Custom field should be showing when creating a new issue.

*Actual Results*
Once a custom field is added in the Create Issue Screen and set it as show in Field Configuration. When a user create an issue, the custome field is not showing. 

*Workaround*
In the create issue view, click on Configure Fields Tab, then Custom. Check the custom fields that you wanted to show. When you next create an issue, JIRA remembers your last choice of selected fields.

fields.description:
JIRA issue view has an attachment section where you can select from two different ways of viewing the attachments, as shown below:
!attach_operations.png|thumbnail!

These operations are intermittently failing (more often failing than working) when we click the part of the menu item containing text. Clicking the items on the sides, where there's not text is working.

The options with this problem are:
* Sort By Name
* Sort By Date
* Ascending
* Descending
* Thumbnails
* List

The 'Download All' and 'Manage Attachments' seem to be working.

The difference between clicking on the text (failing) and clicking somewhere with no text (working) is shown in the video below:
[^attachments_problem.mp4]

This is most likely due to the '<li>' HTML tag be working and the '<a href>' tag not working, which would explain why the area without text works.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an issue in JIRA and open it
# Attach two or more attachments
# Open the attachments menu by clicking the arrow down icon on the right
# Select one of the failing option by clicking over the text

*Expected behavior*
* Option works 
* The new option is shown as selected

*Actual behavior*
* Clicking the text fails most of the time

*Workaround*
* Click the options on the sides (preferable the right side), where there's no text.
fields.summary: Operations in Attachments in issue view are intermittently failing

fields.description:
If a task/subtask/bug is passed between multiple users, then the work logged against that task is not tracked correctly; instead of each work log pointing to the user that logged the work, all time logged is counted against the task's current owner.

E.g.

bug assigned to user1
user1 logs 2h (user1 fixed bug)
user2 takes ownership of bug
user2 logs 1h (user2 retested bugfix)
user2 closes bug

Currently, the final tally of time worked here is:
user1: 0h
user2: 3h

I think this is a bug, since the rest of the Jira UI encourages bugs and tasks to be passed around between users. It's very unwieldy to have to create a separate subtask for each user, particularly if you are handing an existing subtask/bug over.

Expected behaviour is that work logs always count time against the user that logged them, independently of the owner of the associated task/subtask/bug.
fields.summary: Work logs are reassigned to another user if the parent task is reassigned

fields.description:
Some customers, though they're not subscribed to 'Tempo TimeSheet' add-on, have it enabled after the last release to JIRA 7.0.0-OD-02-247. That makes the 'Timesheet' link on the left menu visible for projects, as shown below:
!left_menu.png|thumbnail!

When clicking on this link, the users are taken to a page in Tempo (https://instance.atlassian.net/secure/TempoInfo.jspa?type=v6), which is not available since there's no subscription to Tempo and they get the following permission error:
!tempo_permission_error.png|thumbnail!

I reads:
{panel}
Permission Violation
It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform.
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
{panel}

Since the user is taken to last page of the project they have accessed when navigating to the project, this is always the page they see and they're become unable to navigate to other pages of the project, since the left menu is not longer accessible. Only a direct link access is possible.

This seems to be only impacting instances that were upgraded. Instances created on this version are actually not showing the permission error, but rather a page to enable Tempo.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Have Cloud instance with no Tempo subscription, though still enabled on version prior to 7.0.0-OD-02
# Upgrade it to 7.0.0-OD-02
# Navigate to the project
# Click the 'Timesheet' link on the project's left menu

*Expected Behavior*
* The page to enable Tempo is shown (with the menu on the left to navigate to other pages)

*Actual Behavior*
* Customer can navigate to the page
* The customer can no longer navigate to other pages in that project

*Workaround 1*
* Search for the project's 'Issues' page (it will be the page you'll be taken to from this moment on, unless you click the 'Timesheet' link again)
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/projects/PROJECTKEY/issues
{noformat}

*Workaround 2*
* Disable the 'Tempo Timesheet' add-on so the 'Timesheet' link disappears
fields.summary: Permission error due to Tempo being enabled in Cloud

fields.description:
*Problem Description*

When running Long Running Tasks that last more than 60 seconds, such as issue loading (a lot of comment) or changing scheme etc. It potentially hitting Nginx's 60-second timeout Shows as Page Not Available.

*Expected Result*

It will show a progress bar indicating it is still processing.

*Actual Result*

Forward to a page indicating Page not Available

*Steps to Replicate*

It is hard to reliably replicate this issue, it involves multiple factor. Usage and executing the task listed in the What is affected column below might trigger it.
Or alternatively, create 30k issues and change the issue security scheme. It potentially run into same issue if it took more than 60 seconds to complete the request.

*Additional Context*

When it is showing the error page, it is actually attempting to load the page again after a few second. It become potentially dangerous as it might re-fire the same request.

What is not affectd 

* Creating backup, as it revalidate before it hits into 60 seconds
* Indexing, progress bar

What is affected

* Changing security scheme for a very large instance
* Viewing a very large issue, a lot of comments
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud Long Running Task hitting Nginx's 60-second timeout Shows as Page Not Available

fields.description:
On a JIRA instance that requires you to be signed in to view tickets, 
when navigating to a ticket using the URL (JIRA URL/browse/(project key)-(ticket number), if the issue exists, the user will be redirected to a sign in page, where as if the ticket does not exist, an 'issue does not exist' page is displayed.

While knowing if an issue exists or not is not useful to an attacker, knowing if a project exists may be, for example, to a competitor to an organisation that uses JIRA.

An example where this could be a problem can be taken from an incident a while back where the Valve JIRA was made open, and people found projects named L4D3 and HL3 - codenames for two projects that the public is eager to see released.

It would be trivial to create a script which enumerates all 1-4 character project keys matching pattern [0-9A-F]+ and browses for issue (project key)-1 for each, to see if it existed. At one request a second (which is quite slow, as they could be done asynchronously, and should take less time), all 1,727,604 requests would only take 11.5 days.

The suggested fix is to require login regardless of whether the issue exists or not.
fields.summary: Most project keys can be enumerated by unprivileged user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Cloud may display custom field descriptions as HTML text in screens rather than text, even though no HTML is added to the description

This can be seen in issue create/edit or even bulk edit screen. This seems to be reliable with user custom fields, like 'Single User Picker' or even 'Request Participants' and 'Organization'.

Not all custom fields cause this problem. Here are some fields that cause it:
# Organisations, Approvers and Request Participants show description as HTML without any changes required
# User custom fields (single user, multiple users, etc.)
# 'Reporter' field
# Attachment field

Original reports also mentioned the 'attachment' field had the same problem.

This also causes conversions to HTML entities. For example, the character '<' is converted to '&lt'.

Example:
 !SingleUserPicker.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a description to any of the fields listed in the Field Configuration 
# Add it to a screen
# Open the screen (for example, if you added to the edit screen in a project, edit an issue)

h3. Expected Results

The description shows as text
h3. Actual Results

Descriptions show are converted to HTML.
h3. Workaround

None so far. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Description of some custom fields are converted to HTML

fields.description:
Removing the default POP Mail Server on OnDemand changes the configuration of every Mail Handler using that Server to "Local Files"

Even after a restart of the OnDemand instance, where the default Mail Server and Mail Handlers are reset back to their original state, all the Mail Handlers that used to be configured to use the "POP Mail Server" will still be pointing to use "Local Files".

"Local Files" is an option that is not available on OnDemand so new incoming emails won't be processed.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a Mail Handler that uses the default POP Mail Server
# Remove the POP Mail Server
# Notice how the Mail Handler Server option changed to "Local Files"
# Restart the instance
# Notice how the POP Mail Server was restored but the Mail Handler still points incorrectly to "Local Files"

Image attached shows how one can only select POP Mail Server but still the Server of the Mail Handler points to "Local Files"

*Workaround:*
Edit every Mail Handler, set the Server, save changes.
Emails that weren't processed during the period, will now be processed.
fields.summary: Removing the default POP Mail Server on OnDemand misconfigures Mail Handlers
Use of atlassian-whitelist plugin allows CORS access to origins which it should not

fields.description:
A recent change to add indexing for worklogs introduced a regression on the handling of this error condition when the searchers are being closed with the result that the searcher can never actually be released and permanently breaks whatever threads had accessed it.

This results in errors at attempts to edit or transition issues, for example:
{noformat}
this IndexReader is closed
{noformat}

h4. Workaround

Restarting JIRA and performing a full locking re-index would temporarily fix the issue. This needs to be done by Atlassian OnDemand Support, so if you're running into the error, open a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com/ referring to this bug report, and let us know about a time slot in which a restart wouldn't affect your work.
fields.summary: DelayCloseSearcher needs to be hardened against AlreadyClosedException

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user attempts to associate a new Issue Security Scheme to a large number of issues in a project (in tested cases, upwards of 4,000), the page eventually throws a 'Page Unavailable' error. After one or two tries, the scheme will successfully be associated with the Project / Issues, but the error can confuse the user and make it seem as though it did not complete.


h3. Environment
Not Applicable, only been tested on Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1 - Choose the specific project you need to associate a security scheme with (a project with thousands of issues), and select Issue Security in Project Administration.
# Step 2 - Attempt to associate a security scheme with the project and all contained issues. After step 2, the error will likely be thrown.


h3. Expected Results
The security scheme is associated without any issues.


h3. Actual Results
The scheme often associates, but the error is thrown. Also, when this occurs, I've seen the following Warning in the JIRA log file that I believe is related:
{noformat}
2015-05-19 12:12:02,801 TP-Processor30 WARN sysadmin 732x1125677x3 g5cybo 216.13.177.90,165.254.226.146 /secure/project/SelectProjectSecuritySchemeStep2.jspa [com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'com.atlassian.cache.CacheException - com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Expected BEGIN_OBJECT but was STRING at line 1 column 1'.
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
While the scheme is often associated with the first or second try, there is no workaround to avoid the 'Page Unavailable' error.
fields.summary: 'Page Unavailable' Error When Associating Security Scheme to Large Number of Issues

fields.description:
# Create a new issue ==> Create Issue dialog box appears
# Enter information into dialog, including into several custom fields
# Make sure "Create another" checkbox is checked
# Click "Create" 

*Expected:*  A new Create Issue dialog box appears *with many fields already containing the information previously entered*
*Actual:*  The new Create Issue dialog box appears but *it is not retaining any information from the issue just created.*  The new dialog box is as empty as the first one was.

This was originally reported as JRA-40067.  I'm re-reporting it because, despite numerous comments form users about how this *IS* a serious problem, that item remains resolved as "Not a bug".  It *IS* a bug and it should be in the queue to be fixed.  I'm re-reporting it her in the hopes that Atlassian, at a  minimum (and it would indeed be the _very least_ Atlassian could do) will acknowledge this is a problem that needs to be fixed.  Over in JRA-40067 Atlassian appears to have decided to just ignore the many comments form customers.  Maybe this time they won't. 

It is functionality that was working and heavily relied upon by users.  Then Atlassian broke it.  Getting this back is not a request for new functionality.  It is not a "suggestion".  It is not a report of something that is "not a bug".  It is a bug and it has not been fixed.

It should remain on the list of things that needs to be fixed.   It should not be incorrectly dismissed as "Not a bug".

fields.description:
Hi,

there are a lot of related issues, I hope that this isn't a duplicate of one of them.
If you selected a date in march in german (german word: "März"), the datepicker inserts "mrz", but the form expects "mär".

We are using Atlassian Cloud, the version is 6.4-OD-15-055 (Build-Nummer 64014).
fields.summary: Date picker localization errors in german

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer has specified a Mail Handler to {{Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body}} however the Split Regex is not being used.
h3. Environment
 * 7.0.0-OD-04

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a New Mail Handler using the option {{Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body}}
 # Specify a Split Regex Expression {{/From: |___.|On .*wrote:|----Orig.|On .(JIRA).|.*(JIRA).*wrote:/}}
 # When messages from Outlook are received, the message is not split and show the Old/Quoted Replies
 -- Also note, if a value is added to the message which would match the Regex Expression, it is not split at that point.

h3. Expected Results

Message is Split
h3. Actual Results

If a message is sent that matches the Regex Expression, the quoted text is not removed before the comment is added.

Testing the Regex Expression:
 !RegexTest.png|thumbnail!
We see that the strings match.

Replied to a JIRA message which contains one of the strings however the text after the string is added as a comment:
 !OnExample.png|thumbnail!
 !FromExample.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Mail Handlers Not Splitting Messages with Regex

fields.description:
!image.png!

*Cause:*
An epic link field in the Edit Screen is causing the popup message to appear even though there is no change made. There's an error message in the screen stated that {color:red}A subtask cannot be assigned to an epic{color}.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a new "Agile" project
# Create an issue for the project.
# Create a sub task for the issue of the project
# Press "E" or click on Edit
# Click on Cancel. Popup message stated that "You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost." is displayed.

*Expected:* No popup appear if there is no change made
*Actual Result:* Popup message stated that "You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost." is displayed.

*Notes*
There's an error message in the screen stated that {color:red}A subtask cannot be assigned to an epic{color}. 

*Workaround:*
# Create a new screen for sub-task. You could just simply copy the screen from the original agile screen and make sure you remove the epic link field from the newly created screen.
# Create a new screen scheme and configure the scheme so that the scheme is using the screen that you've just created for the sub-task.
# Go back to the Agile project and associate the screen scheme to issue type sub-task.
fields.summary: Edit Sub-task issue of an Agile Project always detect changes even though no change is made

fields.description:
Say you have two statuses, *OPEN* and *START PROGRESS*.
OPEN has the *jira.permission.assignable.projectrole* property set to *role_A*.
START PROGRESS has the  *jira.permission.assignable.projectrole* property set to *role_B*. 

Transitioning from open to start progress, there is a transition screen with the Assignee field. If you try to assign to someone who is in role_B, the assign will fail with error "cannot be assigned issues". (despite the auto-complete manages to show the user as an assignable user!)

This is *not* the intended behavior because in *JIRA 6.3.4 or older*, you can assign to a user in role_B without problems, since users in role_B matches the workflow property configured in the START PROGRESS status, which is the destination of the transition.
fields.summary: REGRESSION: Changing assignees in transition screen is taking into account the permission property of the CURRENT status, not the DESTINATION status

fields.description:
The current version of OnDemand (6.4-OD-04-007) has a different behaviour with shortcut ‘w’ than previous ones. 

Current version installed with Tempo, in Issue View, has the ‘w’shortcut mapped to operation of adding the current user as a watcher to the issue. The version 6.3.4 of JIRA with Tempo installed had it mapped to log working, opening a window to do so.

The previous configuration open the log work window:
!log_work_window.png!

The current adds the user as a watcher:
* Before pressing 'w':
!before_watching.png!
* After:
!after_watching.png!
fields.summary: Different behavior for ‘w’ shortcut in OnDemand

fields.description:
When the browser-metrics-plugin is disabled, various functionality in the issue navigator and view issue pages are broken.

Example:

h3. ***Symptoms***
- The edit button is not functioning 
- Adding a comment it gives communication breakdown error
- Broken Issue Navigator (cannot navigate from the issue navigator, cannot open filters)

h3. ***Workaround***

* Login to your instance using your administrator account.
* Browse to the "Manage add-ons" page.
* Find the "browser-metrics-plugin" item, expand it, and make sure it is enabled.
fields.summary: Disabled browse-metrics-plugin causes JavaScript errors in issue navigator.

fields.description:
Trying to open a URL for an issue that does not exist shows the "Issue Does Not Exist" error page, even if you are logged out and the project is not publicly viewable.  In contrast, trying to open the URL for valid issue will prompt the user to login.

In this way, an unprivileged user can learn information about what issues exist in the system and, over time, the rate of issue creation.
fields.summary: "Issue Does Not Exist" page leaks information to non-logged in users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In some cases, the JIRA Issues Calendar Gadget displays an error on the JIRA Dashboard and does not display - it cannot be edited and new Calendar objects added have the same problem. 

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud instances running JIRA 7.X

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a dashboard and click *add gadget* 
# Search for the JIRA Issues Calendar gadget and add it to the page
or
# Open a dashboard with an existing JIRA Issues Calendar gadget

h3. Expected Results
* The JIRA Issues Calendar gadget displays a configuration window on the dashboard
or
* The JIRA Issues Calendar displays a calendar

h3. Actual Results
An error appears on the page where the JIRA Issues Macro should be:
"An internal server error occurred when requesting resource".

In the development tools console the following error appears:
{noformat}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 500 (Internal Server Error)
https://<Customer_URL>/rest/calendar-plugin/1.0/calendar/htmlcalendar/config/datefields?_=144106859...{noformat}

An error is seen in the logs:
{noformat}
/rest/calendar-plugin/1.0/calendar/htmlcalendar/config/datefields [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraAuthenticationContext.getLoggedInUser()Lcom/atlassian/crowd/embedded/api/User;
2015-09-01 11:24:00.972843500 java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraAuthenticationContext.getLoggedInUser()Lcom/atlassian/crowd/embedded/api/User;
...
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Calendar Gadget displays error on JIRA Dashboard
JIRA Mobile bundled version 3.0.1 (neither 3.0.2) doesn't work with JIRA master

fields.description:
h3. *Summary* 
The new import options released in JIRA 7 are broken and redirecting to Atlassian.com.
Links: Basecamp, Microsoft TFS, Rally, Microsoft Excel, VersionOne, Youtrack, Axosoft.


h3. *Steps to Reproduce* 
# Choose the cog icon, then choose System under JIRA Administration 
# Click External System Import in the left-hand panel. 
# Try to click any of these links: Basecamp, Microsoft TFS, Rally, Microsoft Excel, VersionOne, Youtrack, Axosoft.


h3. *Expected Results* 
-The links should redirect to the page to start the import process.-
* For importers that are not supported, we wouldn't send them to the start of the import process but rather provide users documentation (inline or redirect) showing them that they can import from those tools using CSV in a certain way.
* Supported importers should continue to the start of their import processes respectively.


h3. *Actual Results* 
The links are broken and redirecting to Atlassian.com.
fields.summary: The new links in JIRA External Import are broken.

fields.description:
Since the JIRA Cloud upgrade on November 2nd  (JIRA 6.4-OD-09) the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Widget lo longer displays the Filter name on it's header. 

This can cause problems to users who use multiple instances of this widget on the same dashboard, since there's no visible way to see which filter is being used on each.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Widget No Longer Displays the Filter Name on It's Header

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate:*

# Create a workflow with a large number of transitions (approximately 50+)
# Try to load the workflow in the UI workflow editor

*Result:*

Workflow will take a long time to load (30 seconds+) in OnDemand this can sometimes throw errors.

*Workaround:*

Change to text mode and edit the workflow there.
fields.summary: Workflow designer is slow to respond in a workflow with large number of transitions
